Item (translated): First of all we ask you for some information about yourself. Like all data collected in this study, this information will be completely anonymized, so that a trace back to your identity is impossible. The collection of this data serves only to provide context for the overall results of the study.
How old are you (in years)?
Scale (translated): (Numerical entry)

Item (translated): What is your gender?
Scale (translated):
female
male
another gender, namely (entry)

Item (translated): What is the highest educational level you have achieved?
Scale (translated):
still a student
dropped out of school without a diploma
secondary school leaving certificate (Hauptschulabschluss) or equivalent
Secondary school leaving certificate (Mittlere Reife) or equivalent
(Specialist) university entrance qualification (Abitur)
(Specialist) university degree (e.g. Bachelor's degree, Master's degree, Diploma)
Doctorate
a different level of education, namely (entry)

Item (translated): What best describes your occupational situation?
Scale (translated):
employed full-time
employed part-time
in vocational training/teaching
student (school)
student (university)
not in paid employment

Item (translated): What is your average monthly net household income?
Scale (translated):
up to 450 euros
between 451 and 1000 euros
between 1001 and 1500 euros
between 1501 and 2000 euros
between 2001 and 2500 euros
between 2501 and 3000 euros
between 3001 and 3500 euros
between 3501 and 4000 euros
between 4001 and 4500 euros
between 4501 and 5000 euros
more than 5000 euros
not specified

Item (translated): How many persons live in your household, including yourself? Consider also children living in the household.

Item (translated): have indicated that x persons live in your household. How many of them are younger than 14?

Item (translated): In which administrative district do you currently live?
Scale (translated): (Choice from drop-down menu)

Item (translated): Some of the following questions deal with the novel coronavirus SARS-CoV-2. The disease caused by an infection with the SARS-CoV-2 pathogen is called COVID-19. When we talk about "corona" and "coronavirus" hereafter, we are referring to this pathogen and this disease.
Are you at increased risk for becoming severely ill from a infection with the coronavirus (e.g. due to age or underlying medica conditions)?
Scale (translated):
yes
no
don't know

Item (translated): Are you or have you been infected with the coronavirus?
Scale (translated):
yes
no
don't know

Item (translated): Did you become so seriously ill with coronavirus that you had to be treated in hospital?
Scale (translated):
yes
no

Item (translated): Do you live with someone who is at increased risk for becoming severely ill from a infection with the coronavirus (e.g. due to age or underlying medica conditions)?
Scale (translated):
yes
no
don't know

Item (translated): How many people do you know personally who are infected or have been infected with the coronavirus?
Scale (translated): (Numerical entry)

Item (translated): You have indicated that you know x people who are or have been infected with the coronavirus. In how many of them has the coronavirus disease been so severe that they had to be treated in hospital?
Scale (translated): (Numerical entry)

Item (translated): Is it currently necessary for you to work or attend your education outside of your home?

yes
